title: The Divine Lilas of Sri Raghava Pandita | Sri Jai Chaitanya Dasa | Gaura Mandala Parikrama
speaker: HG Jai Chaitanya Dasa

segments.key_quote: Sri Radha Madana Mohan Deities, Sri Raghunath Das Goswami's worshipable Sri Sri Radha Raman Deity, these are in this ghat, we know the story of Raghunath Das Goswami and Nityananda Prabhu which happened here and the subsequent Panihatti festival.
segments.summary: Introduction to the holy places and personalities associated with Raghava Bhavan and Panihatti.
segments.transcript: Sri Raghava Bhavan, there is Raghava Pandit Samadhi here, Raghava Pandit's worshipable Sri Radha Madana Mohan Deities, Sri Raghunath Das Goswami's worshipable Sri Sri Radha Raman Deity, these are in this ghat. We know the story of Raghunath Das Goswami and Nityananda Prabhu which happened here and the subsequent Panihatti festival.

segments.key_quote: Lord Chaitanya would always be immersed in the mood of Srimati Radharani and would lovingly accept the prasad brought to him by Raghava Pandita.
segments.summary: Description of Raghava Bhavan as the eternal residence of Lord Gaurahari and Lord Nityananda, and Lord Chaitanya's acceptance of prasad from Raghava Pandita.
segments.transcript: Raghava Bhavan, the residence of Sri Raghava Pandita and his sister Damayanti is renowned all over the three worlds. As the eternal residence of Sri Gaurahari, Lord Gaurah Nityananda have manifested their innumerable heart-rendering pastimes over here at Raghava Bhavan 500 years ago, located on the bank of Ganges at Panihatti. Lord Chaitanya would always be immersed in the mood of Srimati Radharani and would lovingly accept the prasad brought to him by Raghava Pandita.

segments.key_quote: These bags of delicious food items came to be subsequently known as Raghavera Jali, the bags of Raghavendra Pandita.
segments.summary: Explanation of Raghava Pandita's role as an intimate associate of Lord Chaitanya, and the story of Raghavera Jali, the bags of food offerings prepared by Damayanti Devi.
segments.transcript: The Incarnation of Dhanishta Gopi In Chaitanya Charitamrita, it has been revealed that Sri Raghava Pandita was an intimate associate of Lord Chaitanya. Raghavera Jali After accepting his sannyas, Lord Chaitanya Mahaprabhu moved to reside at Jagannath Puri. Every year during the Rathayatra festival, almost all the devotees from Bengal would travel to Puri to unite with Lord Gaurasundara once again. Sri Mati Damayanti Devi would cook innumerable items for Mahaprabhu with her love and affection and devotion and thereafter pack these in separate bags. Raghava Pandita would then carry these bags to Puri during his annual visit and offer them to Lord Chaitanya. These bags of delicious food items came to be subsequently known as Raghavera Jali, the bags of Raghavendra Pandita.

segments.key_quote: It was the love and devotion of both brother and sister that made these foodstuffs even more tasty.
segments.summary: Emphasis on the importance of love and devotion in the preparation of Raghavera Jali, and Lord Chaitanya's appreciation of the food offerings.
segments.transcript: And they find a very special mention in Chaitanya Bhagavata and Sri Chaitanya Charitamrita. Sri Krishnadas Kaviraj conceded in Chaitanya Charitamrita that it was impossible in one's lifetime to list down all the wonderful eatables contained in Raghavera Jali. It was the love and devotion of both brother and sister that made these foodstuffs even more tasty. Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu would honor and relish them for a continuous one year until Raghava Pandita brought fresh food items.

segments.key_quote: ecstatic pastimes at the following four places, the house of Mother Sachi, that is Satchira Mandira, wherever Nithyananda Prabhu dances, that is Nithyananda Narthena, then during Sankirtana at the house of Shiva's Pandit, Shiva's Angan and the residence of Raghava Pandit, Raghava Bhavan.
segments.summary: Listing of four places where ecstatic pastimes took place, including Raghava Bhavan.
segments.transcript: ecstatic pastimes at the following four places, the house of Mother Sachi, that is Satchira Mandira, wherever Nithyananda Prabhu dances, that is Nithyananda Narthena, then during Sankirtana at the house of Shiva's Pandit, Shiva's Angan and the residence of Raghava Pandit, Raghava Bhavan.

segments.key_quote: It was here at Panihatti on the bank of Ganges that Raghunath Das Goswami, the son of the earth's white wealthy landlord of Saptagram, Sri Govardhan Majumdar, had received the costless mercy of Sri Nithyananda Prabhu.
segments.summary: Description of Nithyananda Prabhu's stay at Raghava Bhavan and the Panihatti festival, where Raghunath Das Goswami received his mercy.
segments.transcript: Whenever Nithyananda Prabhu and his associate used to return to Bengal from Puri, they used to stay at Raghava Bhavan. Nithyananda Prabhu has manifested many awe-inspiring pastimes here. It was here at Panihatti on the bank of Ganges that Raghunath Das Goswami, the son of the earth's white wealthy landlord of Saptagram, Sri Govardhan Majumdar, had received the costless mercy of Sri Nithyananda Prabhu. It was Nithyananda Prabhu's mercy that enabled Sri Raghunatha to later obtain the shelter and service at the feet of Lord Chaitanya. Raghunatha went on to become one of the six Goswamis of Vrindavana and is renowned all over the three worlds for his renunciation and love for the Supreme. So that is Panihatti. So we know about the Panihatti festival. Nithyananda Prabhu was there and Raghunatha Goswami, Raghunatha was ordered to feed all the brahmanas, all the devotees and every year at Panihatti this festival is commemorated.
